qas.question: Which city is the capital of Telangana?

answers.text: Hyderabad (i/ˈhaɪdərəˌbæd/ HY-dər-ə-bad; often /ˈhaɪdrəˌbæd/) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Telangana

qas.question: How many square miles does Hyderabad cover?
What river is Hyderabad next to?
What is the population of Hyderabad?
At what altitude is Hyderabad, in meters?

context: <a0_0>Hyderabad (i/ˈhaɪdərəˌbæd/ HY-dər-ə-bad; often /ˈhaɪdrəˌbæd/) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Telangana<a0_0/> and de jure capital of Andhra Pradesh.[A] Occupying 650 square kilometres (<a1_0>250 sq mi<a1_0/>) along the banks of <a2_0>the Musi River<a2_0/>, it has a population of <a3_0>about 6.7 million<a3_0/> and a metropolitan population of about 7.75 million, making it the fourth most populous city and sixth most populous urban agglomeration in India. At <a4_0>an average altitude of 542 metres<a4_0/> (1,778 ft), much of Hyderabad is situated on hilly terrain around artificial lakes, including Hussain Sagar—predating the city's founding—north of the city centre.
